bKSKyvgC7mttuz0z4tZ2mQ.text: This is an awesome experience if you ever want to have a burger like you have never ever had one before. The flavor just explodes in your mouth. There will definitely be a party in your mouth and tummy if you go to this place and eat.

QONzuSVPGF3tT_sybmYO0A.text: If you like $10 hamburgers then stop reading now! If you are a health food nut, move on. If you like really good burgers and dogs with the best chili I have ever tasted, this is the place. This place is literally a hole in the wall, but you will find people from all walks of life standing in line. Their chili is one of a kind. It is very dry, not tomato based, lots of black pepper, very unique and delicious. They also serve breakfast, not bad but lunch is better.

F8opNtJeKz9cr9_Q-BzZxQ.text: I LOVE a dive! This qualifies in spades.  Kinda under the tracks around the way; obscure. You gotta know where you're going.  Parking lot has picnic tables. Inside: tight space standing room only (maybe six or so can fit without getting too icky), quintessential divey decor, old signs etc.  Ventilation system struggling to keep the smell of cooking food to a minimum.  Staff is friendly and attentive.  Not a bad idea to call ahead and yes, have cash.  I'm trying to talk about all the great dive like qualities they have with out addressing the food.  I loved the vibe.  Ok.  The food?  Not so great.  The exalted chili?  Bland.  I detected some black pepper but salt not so much. It was meaty, give credit there. Ground beef cooked up with onions; that's what I saw(you can see them cooking) not much else.  Nothing to make it come together. I really liked all about them I experienced in the world of dives, but the food.  Just not there.  Is it a value?  Hard to say.  If I want to enjoy it? Not really. There's a place not too far that  gives loads of cheap food at ridiculous prices.  That's value. No matter how mediocre their service the food is at least seasoned.  I really wanted to like this place more.  The people and atmosphere seemed just right.  The food was just wrong.

uv5_y8VbpgSVrl4aUPPmeg.text: This review is only based on one visit, but I think its safe to say i'm a fan. Finally visited the red sandwich house, after driving by it a couple of times always wondering why all those people were outside! With very limited hours it took me a while to get down here, as I don't work in the area, but thankfully a day off during the week enabled me to grab a bite!  Very small little 1 room "house". No frills, what you see is what you get. They have a flat top, deep-fryer, toaster oven to warm buns, a few heat lamps to keep fries hot, and that's about it. Walk in (if there is room), place your order, wait a few mins, pay and leave happy. Very basic food, burgers, dogs, sandwiches, and some good breakfast stuff from the looks of it as well.  I had a bacon cheeseburger, and it was great. Perfectly juicy, with that little bit of flat-top crustiness. And to top it off, its all super cheap. Can't wait to get back for another burger!

EnFx8vLGxSDMWM_Cl5qwEg.text: why is no one talking about the bacon   seriously their bacon is the best part and they will not tell me where they get it,  please get your burger all the way WITH bacon.  Solid burger, not the best I have ever had but a must try, especially if you are hungover.  My only complaint (and this is my fault) I can easily eat two burgers (dont get a double  its too much meat)  The staff is super friendly but you better be prepared to wait cause the secret is definitely out!

y7pGIWB6qjHSjQIvzdH-ew.text: Don't expect a fancy-schmancy burger place.  It's literally a one-room house, with no sitting.  You can eat at the counter inside, or stand at the not-quite-tall-enough-to-be-a-counter outside under the shelter.  Simple burgers, and price includes all the way (mustard, onions and chili), with small change for extra toppings.  Two thumbs.

C1Yz-Qd8HHoLdKzN-It9AQ.text: It's super cheap, it's relatively fast, and you can't walk out without smelling like meat and grease. These are all the requirements I never knew I needed from a burger place. It is literally a shack, and as soon as you walk in you're smoked out by the busy grill, but you don't even care, because you know you're smelling what's about to come. And you bet I enjoyed every bite of what's about to come. On top of that, I actually enjoyed standing outside at the table and eating alongside some strangers (whom I ended up getting to know). My mom and I got the fish filet sandwich, burger all the way, a burger with lettuce/tomato/slaw, and a liverwurst sandwich. She threw in cheese fries with her burger and I threw in hashbrowns with mine. THE HASHBROWN DID NOT DISAPPOINT. Everyone, PLEASE get the hashbrown. It's crispy, it's hot, and it's soft on the inside--exactly what you want out of your McDonald's hashbrown order but never get. My one gripe is that whenever I get a burger all the way, I really want coleslaw as well, so I was mildly disappointed that theirs doesn't have coleslaw. But since I can easily add it next time, I know it's gonna be outta this world. I've never been so excited about a burger place before.

XSyMs7gazXL-Qlc9BmGh7g.text: Old school,  good 'ol boy,  greasy dive with good food.   Think Price's Chicken Coop except they serve burgers, dogs and awesome breakfast sandwiches.  I generally order egg, cheese and livermush sandwich and when really dropping my guard top it with their homemade chili (why are the good things soooo very bad for you?).  Way under $5 with a large coffee.   Lots of local flair, interesting staff and strictly cash only.  Take out only (suggest you eat under the shade tree on the wooden trough.  You might make a friend,  too).  Closed on the weekends.

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. My lucky day!  Breakfast was only $.42!  Forty-two cents?  Yes!!
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Their cheeseburger all-the-way.  Way 2 go!
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Livermush, egg &amp; cheese breakfast sandwich with coffee for $3.75.  Yummy!

-ALjLv42F1vNtvNqOpr4zw.text: After a write up in the Charlotte Agenda naming Brooks as one of the places every Charlottean should try, I was intrigued and immediately put it on my list.  I opted for a regular cheese burger (ketchup and mayo) only and an order of fries.  The burger was juicy but otherwise no frills.  Their fries are wedge cut fries that were fresh and delicious.  A couple of things to note:  they are CASH only.  It is basically a walk up counter to order.  They do not have seating.  There is a large communal table under the protection of a pavilion.  Many were eating in their cars.  There is ample parking.  They are only open Mon-Fri until 3:00 pm.  All in all it was a cheap, quick lunch and I am glad I have finally dined at this local landmark; however, I do not see me having cravings for a Brooks burger.

9soDcBzFx8hNZ8XFDECjhg.text: Horrible experience here. Staff treated my brother in-law with such disrespect. We will never be back here.  The staff raised their voice at him in front of other customers. In return we asked for our money back. He was discriminated against and the embarrassment of being disrespected in front of others will make assure we will never come back here again. I will be sure to tell all of my friends and family.

HhmnIGoXXXtsFhx_gRA5Lw.text: So you want a great burger and someone suggests Brooks. You go to this small building on a piece of dirt on the side of the new light rail. There is no place to sit. Just a wood stand up table under some trees.  So you order a burger and stand at a table and listen and get involved in the conversations around you. The burgers are amazing and the conversations are fantastic. A unique old time Charlotte experience

X64KYhSgPkEGRVLwdqIEPg.text: We had lunch about week ago and as always, excellent cheeseburger, but this time we added bacon. A great addition to an already fantastic cheeseburger. Look forward to our next visit.

EYA3Coe5btU_2h_IT6hSeg.text: Insane wait but every bite was worth it.  Ask for the burger all the way and get the fries. Burgers aren't huge so you'll want them.

NX7-IQHQw7nYcxI9eZncBQ.text: Best hole-n-the wall Burger joint I have tried.  This is not a place for the health conscious,  but it is a place for great burgers and dogs.  They even sale Bologna and liver mush sandwiches.  Takes me way back.  Must go place.

wnSljOJM8Q-1VgO1VdTmpw.text: Be sure to take cash!  This place is definitely worth a visit or 2 or 3! Burgers, dogs, and fries are all good! I wish they were open on weekends!

Pbnv4v9Nt1ZCY2zdhWw9NQ.text: Cutest little place ever! They have the best hotdogs and bologna sandwiches ever and the people there are amazing and so sweet! If I could give them more stars I would(:

fvw2Fc7hcDoT0OaCYhpcJw.text: Wow! Awesome burgers and fries! This place is the apitome of a dive with amazing food.  Some important points: cash only, no seating  (just order, pick up and go), but there is an outdoor table. The burger should ONLY be ordered ALL THE WAY; it's worth it trust me!

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States

j6W4ef41JzJNd2ObRolb5A.text: Brooks Sandwich House. You can throw all of the expected dopey descriptors in their direction, should you feel so equipped to do so -- "A True, American classic!" "The BEST burger in all of Charlotte!" "A real staple, by golly!" ......whatever. Pick your favorite.   My take? It's the shining star in a sea of dying breeds for truckers, blue collar, and white collar alike. It's the kind of place, on the local level, that you want to have memories of. You need to experience a burger wrapped in paper and eaten at the dirty, standing room-only, picnic tables. You need to experience the "line" during the lunch rush. It's a timeless favorite.   Would you know about Brooks from reading some hip, haute cuisine magazine? Absolutely not. You're either going to stumble across the reviews and hear about how it's a stellar burger stop with great fries or your friend's grandma's church member's daughter used to go when she was a kid and you have to try it.   It's a dive and it's utterly perfect. My only regret is that I didn't get my burger all-the-way -- chili, onions, and mustard. That sounds like heaven.   Do yourself and everyone else a favor and go have your own experience at Brooks.

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Damn good fries
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burger

aFmGKb4xswfWi_hdevcy-w.text: Definitely the best Carolina style burger for the $ in Charlotte.  Fries just ok.  Haven't tried anything else.

81X8gAVdiDfH3xyRczDmPw.text: All the things are True. Just go and check it out.   For less than $5 I walked out with a cheeseburger all the way (onion, chili, & mustard) and a sweet tea.   Cash ONLY.

I62XnNp9RRCU3uTg9lfUhg.text: It is not that Brooks Sandwich House was bad, it just didn't live up to expectations. The food is cheap, it is tasty, but it isn't special. If no one told me I would not have guessed it to be one of the top ranked burgers in Charlotte. Read more at: eatitcharlotte.com/2017/...

wA9dnYfQ9UrbVVGFbK-7-A.text: First things first CASH ONLY, learned that the hard way and had to eat the ATM fee they had there.  I will say I was extremely surprised by Brooks even though it was recommended to me by so many people I went in not expecting much.  However, their burgers are delicious!  They are not super premium steak burgers or anything, but you can tell they pay attention to the details because they are classic burgers done right, and with lots of extras if you want.  They use a coney style chili for their burgers and it was really good and I can be had to impress in that growing up in the greater Detroit area.  Their fries are seasoned well too.

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burger with bacon, cheese, onion, and coney style chili

tUJVAk8ZYKk_bwomSV88nA.text: This. Place.  I can't believe I've lived in Charlotte for 5 years and somehow hadn't wandered over to Brooks'. It's perfect casual location for a take-out lunch with friends.  I looked on Yelp to make sure we were all talking about the same place. Greasy, happy food in paper bags-cash only. Yep, that's the one.  We arrived and I was immediately overcome with the aroma of sizzling beef. Vegetarian or not, you can't argue with that smell. It's divine.  One of my dining partners, a MD, is a regular, and I heard shouts of, "Hey, Doc!" and realized the owners have a personal relationship with their customers. Something I truly appreciate.  Having perused the menu ahead of time, I found that there aren't really any overt vegetarian options, but I didn't let that dampen my enthusiasm. I opted for an off-the-menu grilled cheese with tomato. No balking by the staff, and I think my sandwich was sublime. Coupled with fresh, nicely salted fries and a canned soft drink, it left nothing to be desired.  What I appreciated about the grilled cheese is that it was served on a hamburger bun, but was pressed almost like a cuban sandwich...so the edges were crisp and held up well to the potentially soggy tomato situation.  Once we received our orders, labeled in small paper bags, it was out to the covered, long, standing picnic table just outside the door. I love the communal dining aspect of the experience and the opportunity it afforded to enjoy a lunch while standing and chatting with my friends.  One of the twin brothers stepped outside to share a joke with our party. Super southern, super kind.   They're open for breakfast and lunch, Monday through Friday, and appear to have a large, fiercely loyal following. Apparently their chili is a big deal.   So go try Brooks'. Take along a few friends, a $20 and some TUMS.   You'll leave happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled cheese w/tomato and fries.
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Communal dining
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States

laDyvupsreZu0Zt8cZaBiw.text: I've had Brooks bookmarked for quite some time after seeing it profiled on some Food Network or Travel Channel show on great burgers and finally found myself in the area and hungry.  The building is small and all orders are to go where you can eat them standing up at wooden tables outside if you want to stay on premises.  Not sure how long Brooks has been around but there was a sign inside thanking customers for 40 years of support.  Thing is, the sign looked like it had been there for 40 years so lets just say, they've had staying power!  It's a very limited menu with mainly burgers and dogs and they do serve breakfast sandwiches in the morning.  Liver mush and egg sammie anyone??  I got the burger I saw on the show which was a cheeseburger ATW which at Brooks means chili, mustard, slaw and chopped onions.  The burger was a fat patty of clearly fresh beef and the sandwich as a whole was outstanding.  Best burger ever?  No, I make those at home but, still damn good and really cheap.    This is clearly one of those local institution type joints and I have a special place in my heart for mom and for pop.  Am very glad I came to Brooks!

65mcCF0Hb0BhqtwmvAf2UQ.text: I was hesitant to write this post as I didn't want to share my secret of the best burgers in Charlotte.  The ONLY downfall to this place (which I can respect) is they are only daytime hours m-f.  You know you are about to get some decent food when you roll up to a cinderblock building and construction workers and uptown bankers are all gathered around outside to get one of Charlotte's best kept secrets.  There are no seats or bathrooms in this place, but there are stand up tables to eat outside.  Bring cash as cards are not accepted.  Oh, and my insider tip- double patty bacon cheese burger with a slab of fried bologna on top.  BOOM!  The chili burger is AMAZING too!

R-dnwHcAd99lCMuDZEpc3A.text: This is an absolutely wonderful place to experience down home, homemade, american burgers.  The meat is actually - meat!  It is incredible and instead of fries, they serve very thick, fresh, steamy wedges.  If you are ever in Charlotte, this is the place to drop by (bring a napkin!).

u8zqbRrlV-pXTZwpDA68Kw.text: This place serves up an excellent burger, and equally excellent hot dog, and the FFs are no slouch either. This is a takeout only, hole in the wall place, kind of buried on a side street in a Charlotte neighborhood off North Davidson.  We tried 2 cheeseburgers ($3.50 each), one with L,T, & Mayo, and one ATW with M, C, & O. Both were out of sight good, but the ATW burger was a little better - as good a diner style burger as you're gonna find in the state - up there with PB's in Winston, Char-Grill in Raleigh, and Wimpy's in Durham.  The Hot Dog ($2.00) is also as good as it gets in a classic Southern Chili dog - great tasting, meaty chili, decent wiener, and a good bun. This is as good as Green's here in Charlotte, and just a smidge behind PB's. The FFs ($2) were very, very good. Will definitely try the Chili Cheese Fries next time (they go foe $3.75)  The have barbecue on the menu, but just in the fall, I was told. Darn!  These are world class burgers and hot dogs, and at these prices, they are beyond a value meal. Not coming back is not an option

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Very Nice Cheeseburger.
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. A Great Southern Chili Dog!
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. It&#39;s a small place.

74aoJ83RP3FAXRxSwBFDxQ.text: I had wanted to try this place for a while as I've seen all the accolades for their food. I knew before hand about the restaurant being cash only, so that was okay. Between my boyfriend and myself, we got two burgers, a hotdog, and chili-cheese fries. My boyfriend described the chili as chopped pepper steak ... it looked like chopped meat and I did taste the spicy, peppery-ness of it, but it wasn't in a sauce or tomato based like I expect most chili to be. It was very tasty, nonetheless.  The burgers and hotdog were also good.   Food was an A+. The wait was a D-. Since the restaurant is only open from 7am to 3pm during the week (not open on weekdays), if you are going for lunch, you have to take time out of your workday.  For 4 food items, we waited almost 30 minutes.  I don't know if when we got there if the day was atypical or not, but they do note on their website that for call in orders, expect 20 to 25 minutes. There is no seating, so be prepared to stand.  I think the food was really good, maybe even better than other burger places in Charlotte, but given the long wait, it would probably be better to call in ahead of time and pick up your food so you don't have to wait as long standing outside.

rQjoZrpyYlO1gOYSotCzDw.text: I've tried a total of five times to enjoy brooks and I just can't. There is far better chili cheese burgers in the city. This place gets a lot of hype and has a loyal following to each there own but I just don't get it. The chili isn't amazing the burger was tough and 3/5 times I've come they are out of fries or bacon I personally think the diamond right around the corner has a all around better burger

GLnvf84ztIlQwL3XNfg-IA.text: Simple and delicious!  Go early.  Bring a friend.  Bring cash.  Get the cheeseburger.  Get it all the way.  Stand outside.  Enjoy.  Gym tomorrow.

aq-sHYd2tlxSoxZva9c6bQ.text: Delicious burgers and fries for a great price. A must stop if you are visiting Charlotte

JoY0laRpkwPx2WDSJNzc8g.text: Fresh patted burgers, very good hot dogs, excellent homemade chili, delicious slaw and very reasonable prices!

95Ww0XzK3z9CFVQ7turJOA.text: Best burgers and fries for great prices! I also tried out the hot dogs today  and loved those too! The only thing is the wait is a long time so if you're in a rush, don't come here for lunch. The staff is very friendly and always happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. So delicious!

BCt89q9J6RB75G1Z7HqeAw.text: Absolutely amazing!!!  I was looking for an unusual and unforgettable lunch experience while I'm in NC for 36 hours...this place is IT! Fresh ingredients and incredible flavors!! The place is a little hole in the wall and the people are all about southern hospitality. My new favorite place in Charlotte!

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZWRES1cqa1wEXypJBPjvxg.text: Ordered burger all the way (with chili, mustard, cheese, onions), drink, and fries.   The burger was great for it's price. THERE IS NO WOW FACTOR about the burger, it just taste good. Its done right. Its simply the classic american smashburger. I recommend going there with friends, enjoy the atmosphere, and avoid lunch hour.   Also BRING CASH

cDCB4qPRwPfs0NKF23mmTw.text: Its the best cheap eats in Charlotte!!! Delicious and super simple...awesome burger, unbelievable chili and must-get fries!!! Try to call it in around 11 am or so because during lunch time their phone is off..its best to do that so you are not waiting for an hour  but its worth the wait nonetheless. Keep in mind, its a shack with no proper ventilation so you would habe either wait in your car or outside (no sitting).   I wish they would open on weekends...as their hours are Mon to Fri 7 am to 3 pm (what a working schedule)  But people! This is definitely a must try..

TDBVDOwJsSweuMGfP37hng.text: The menu is simple and it's a hole in the wall, but it really might be the best burger in the city. Gotta try it all the way your first time (chili, mustard, onions). Cash only I believe so plan accordingly.

dOiMyniLwuJLi1N-r3-MLQ.text: If your looking for a super cheap breakfast or lunch this is the place. It's take out only but they have bar height tables outside you can stand at to eat. Their burgers are super greasy but in a good way. They could use a bit of upkeep on the property to make it more ascetically pleasing. Just know this place is a dive with dive food and dive ambiance. Totally scrummy to have a juicy burger at 10am for $3.50

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States

EzZyqWq4UXhCT-hK1nNN2Q.text: I absolutely love their hamburgers and hot dogs. They only take cash so be prepared. The line is always long but the wait isn't too bad. It's no inside seating.

hgFHtXqPfEJjFFEggDB5cw.text: delicious burgers! wish they opened on weekends, very difficult to get to otherwise. SO and I planned to grab lunch here after a weekday flight when we both had taken time off work. SOO good! Cash Only & prepare to wait if you go during lunch hours

12JSfD3Pu_xZb_EQ_2nqSA.text: This place is A1. Wowzers. I decided to cheat on my Pescatarian diet for the beginning of Fall (sounds better than I felt like eating a sloppy burger) and ended up here after asking Yelp for help!! THANK GOD I DID!! I got a cheeseburger "with everything" & a fry. AMAZING. Gives 5 Guys or any other favorite a run for it's money. FOR SURE!! Closes @3p & you need cash which are 2 green lights to go. ANYWHERE that only takes cash & only stays open for lunch is Yelper for "GREAT FOOD IS MADE HERE"... Amen.

v1s_AOPDlxqGdzyLJo2Stg.text: I consider myself a burger connoisseur of sorts... This was one of the first burger places I went to when I moved to Charlotte.  This place is very good. I got the Burger all the way with slaw. It was just solid and super affordable. I wouldn't change a thing.

tRr93-RIa7nSVNGZhKW5Rg.text: Great 'all-the-way' burgers - and love to have lunch at Brooks whenever I need to head-on into the city. Sadly, there's only this one location in NoDa :-( but well worth a visit whenever I'm in the NoDa area. Try to get there by 11:30-ish and beat the lunch crowd - cuz it can get backed-up a bit during lunch hour with all the burger lovers in CLT.

3cdaNAnx_R-kk1KZYl-_Zw.text: What a great little dive. It's so simple and perfect.  I was looking for something greasy to settle my hangover and Brooks didn't disappoint.  Got the burger all the way with chili, mustard and onions.  The chili really made this thing.  I thought it was seasoned better than the burger.  Tried ordering the chicken filet, but they were 89'd so I went with the fish sandwich.  I added tomato and lettuce with a side of tartar sauce, which put it all together.  I enjoyed this one as well.  This place has been around for a while and you can see and taste why.  Can't wait to stop in again and try their Carolina dog!

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. All the way is the only way.

K_shd_bkNGLXGNglCGqG6g.text: Best Cheeseburger I've ever ate! My favorite little place. It doesn't get better than this! I don't care where you go. From upscale to diners they got them all beat!

vxnRSH-tD2nlHXA86lWFLg.text: Brooks is a nice little joint. Fast service. Polite people. I got the chili cheese fries and chili cheese bacon burger. It was good. My only complaint is that the beef could've been more seasoned but I would go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States

oedTWUPYDiEfKWMLkai3jg.text: Stopped by Brooks on a recent visit to Charlotte to renew my long love affair with this great Charlotte eatery.  The area I now live in has their share of good, old school burger joints, but not the awesome divey-ness of Brooks.  And the great prices are just the bonus to the tasty food.  Not much to say that other reviewers haven't said so well.  Just go, and bask in the glow of a fried bologna sandwich with all the trimmings or a loaded chili burger.  Adding chili to everything is the law here....it's a perfect topping for most every sandwich they offer.  My only wish would be to clone Brooks and drop it in my neighborhood.

0He5xZhOcAwg3ifRZMVwJg.text: Got a cheeseburger all the way with chili. The chili is a joke and the burger I can get anywhere. 6.50 for a burger small fries and a can of coke was pretty insulting. The fact it was voted Charlottes best burger makes me question the taste of Charlotte. I would not mention eating here to anyone.

fYPIcACr6deeTW9k1cSAtg.text: David & Scott have an awesome restaurant and they have been there for may years. I had the burger with chilli and it was the best I have ever had.  If you looking for place have great food check out this place. Don't judge the book by it's cover. You'll be very happy .It's set up as a to go , or you can eat outside. Enjoy!!

-HZx1TBIlavJX0OYStJ6uw.text: This is a must stop at least once kind of place.  It was a great burger $3.50 with cheese.   Limited menu but what they do they do well.  If your in Charlotte you have to make the Brooks pilgrimage at least once.

_GTCYCw5vrlOsSlgH82MXw.text: Such a generous and friendly staff!  Family owned and operated, this is what small business is all about!

_RBndkEna9HEkNk2WteR7Q.text: Good burger but not great or the best as advertised.  Cheese and chili fries were above ave as well.  Very good.

APrAbSD5ZIB2cIZxWHhxKQ.text: Please consider this an apology to all the vegetarians and vegans around the world...sorry...but...  I love bacon. Crispy bacon with the perfect amount of salt and crunch...but not too crunchy of course. Oh, and a touch of grease please. Now, I don't eat bacon too often but for some reason I had an insane hankering for a BLT the other day when I was driving around NoDa. And then the light bulb flickered in my little head...Brooks...Sandwich...House.   This unassuming little house is simple - a counter, a few friendly employees and cash only. I ordered my BLT, paid the $3 and change and went on my merry way. The bacon was cooked to perfection and the sandwich was the exact no frills option I was seeking. And hey, those breakfast sandwiches look pretty delightful, too.   Now I'll need to make my way back here (very soon) to dive into a burger...I hear they're fantastic...thanks, Brooks!

abBlPHpgq5TVP3of4UGMRg.text: I wouldn't normally give 5 stars to any place, but I've had a lot of burgers and nothing beats Brooks. Order yourself a cheeseburger all the way (southern style: cheese, onions, chili, mustard) and be prepared for the most delicious mouth-gasm ever.  Their hours are weird, they only accept cash but it is worth going out of your way to eat here.

Gb6W4st6y8Kk5jRBBEzcGQ.text: The building is a little worn down but the burgers are outstanding! Easy 5/5! Just remember to bring cash, they don't take card.

uPESnBYdrBYzHPcQIxN6kg.text: The chili cheeseburger is phenomenal!! The place is a hole-in-the-wall but its a must try!! They only accept cash and there is no seating. There is a big picnic table behind the restaurant (beside the trash cans), and its not uncommon to see white collar and blue collar workers enjoying a classic American burger at this table. During lunch, the line wraps around the building. If you love burgers, you have to try this place.  They also make an excellent sausage sandwich for breakfast.

YRHjEOnH60wUZncw9uXIfg.text: I finally had a chance to check out Brooks last week. Wow! Not only can I not believe I've never been here but I'm surprised that I'd never even heard of this place until recently (That statement makes me sound like I should know everything and I don't...not even close, but still.). As others have said, it's not a place that you will just casually pass by. You have to know where you're going to find it. Glad I did. I got the chili cheeseburger w/ fries and a Cheerwine. Not only tasty but filling. Yes, I would say they have some really good burgers but more importantly I would say that this is a place people have to experience just to say they did. It's a throw back to simpler times where you find extremely loyal customers clamoring to a local tradition. Consider me apart of that now!

pDj6qr2dYK-zj6zufbsqVQ.text: I am not a food snob-really. Beer, yes; food...I'll slum it. Brooks is the best, bar NONE, burger joint I have been to since I left NYS 9 years ago. Yee-HAW! A friend brought me there to experience what he called a regular meal-stop over the course of 30 years, and so I could share it with my other half on his next visit- and we SHALL go here again!!! Service was friendly and social. Burgers were awesome. Atmosphere brought back fond memories of home- for those of you from the Hudson River Valley in NYS- think Red Rooster in Brewster, but BETTER, albeit no miniature golf! Brooks is basically a walk-up version of a drive-through, except the food is far better. No cardboard patty served on a cardboard bun here!!! Sides are great and the chili??  Oh.My.GAWD! Gonna eat here more.

brqQzACh879PWwT6E6ku9Q.text: Had the cheeseburger and also the BLT and both were very good. This is a small place so keep your eyes open or you'll miss it. Oh and they only take cash, so don't plan on paying with anything else. But on the plus side they have a ATM inside.

RfHFhMrmuZn08nkK7WMB4Q.text: This place is pretty great and gets even better when you have a hangover!!   Bacon Egg and Cheese on a roll (potato) is pretty freeking good!! Just the right amount of Bacon with just the right amount of Grease!! I have also had the Hot Dogs which also can do no wrong in my eyes!! Perfectly cooked with just the right amount of CRUNCH!! Burgers are great too!!   The interior is very small I have always taken my food to go, but they do have picnic tables outside. Do expect a crowd around early lunch time but not to worry the lines move quick! Only bummer about this place is the hours- wish they were open 24hrs just for those nights when you've been out drinking and all you really want is a Bacon Egg and Cheese!!! A girl just wants what she wants, when she wants it!!

Olt0Qv5rORXXU1khyXYrOA.text: I found this place because of their ranking as the best burger in Charlotte. I do need to say that it is a great burger, but it's a great burger because of it's bare-bone, quick service attributes.  I personally love this place; however, I do have to point out that the hours they are open makes it very difficult to partake in this phenomenal burger.

06qNSE466quLrsRpzn0CXQ.text: Chili Dogs "All The Way" here are pretty quintessential "carolina style" and not to be missed.  Add slaw for a twist.  The burgers are also perfect.

q8AGpfXyAgR1vDTpnP-yAQ.text: Had lunch here today for the first time.  Reminded me of burger joints when I was younger in my hometown.  No frills, cash only, all totals come out to an even dollar.  Cheeseburger all the way, mustard, onions, and chili.  I'll go back, especially when I feel homesick.

Jv4ENnCHqiiLz2z-Hwc3Ww.text: I thought about how good that fish sandwich was all day. It was big enough, but I think next time I will just order two... Cause I'm 'Merican.

iIVL7gWgMRdu3VRqw8LaGA.text: Small place only opened M-F 7am-2pm...But what a great burger, order to go. The people are great and the food is awesome. One of the best burgers I have ever had in Charlotte.

S7HcXcOUpEXsQF6VDIhD2Q.text: I did not like Brooks at all.  I ordered a chicken sandwich and fries.  I didn't think either were good.  The chicken was bland and the fries were worse.  The only reason this place didn't get a 1 star is because the price was really cheap.  I guess I should have expected it.

sbWeKiQsxTBTCVFkBiCRtA.text: If you're a Burger person like the Son of Samo is, then look no further for the Best Burger in the USA! Brooks has the best burger this Hamburgler has ever slid down his pipe hole. Ordered All the Way means homemade chili, mustard, and onions. The patty is thin, delicious, crisp, and juicy. If you want to experience a True work of art then stop by Brooks!

ZrrrrwFvfz8jVptRTQbXOA.text: Yeah, this place is REEEEEAAALLLL good.   "Cheeseburger all the way and an order of fries" is all you need to utter to the girl at the counter to make the future of your day look brighter. If burgers could snuggle I would want to cuddle up to this one and never let it go (until I ate it all I guess). It should be noted that the fries are actually potato wedges which I don't normally get down with too much but there is something special about the ones at Brooks that makes them doubly delish.   Do your taste buds a favor, bring a wad of Washingtons, show up early and show up often.

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheeseburger all the way. Yeah I add L &amp; T so I feel at least a tad &#34;healthy&#34;
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. The magical fries

CAQwVLzSJPuqfcs0WuqXeg.text: If you want a great burger with no hype, this is your place. A little hard to find but you will remember the address after your first visit. Great burger, good price , fast service. If you show up and see nothing but Construction and work trucks, you know that it is a good spot to eat lunch.

JG20Jh5m8zIy0hYA57zQaw.text: Talk about a hole in the wall (but don't let that scare you away)! What this place lacks in amenities, they make up for in a very tasty burger. Is it a little greasy? Sure. Just be sure to jog 4 miles before lunch and you'll be fine. Also to note is they serve a good breakfast as well starting at 7am.  Be sure to check your watch before you go, they are not open for dinner and close at 3pm. They are also closed on Saturday & Sunday. Make sure you have real, paper currency as well. They have an ATM in the corner but the fee is scandalous!

HWb8DELh0RisZ32IBQlOBg.text: Still the best burger and hot dog in the world. Got to go all the way. Mustard chili and onions. Even if you don't think you'd like it that way, well worth the try. One thing I do like is the onions. They are not hot. They must rinse or use really sweet one. They compliment the burger and dog very well. Lastly, take some chili home. They sell it by the pound. It's magical. And don't ask what's in it. You'll never know. Wish they'd put it back in stores.

TgsTld6boymUxas9PImvnA.text: It was my first time eating here. I had a burger and fries. They cook the food as you order it. I thought it was going to take a while but it was pretty quick. The burger was greasy but good. They serve steak fries and they were fresh. It was crowded so that means people know about this place. I was very impressed with the food and I will be coming back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Eating in the car
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States

vfJQNZLFUvmhVxhQSjSdAA.text: Don't shoot me but I didn't get the cheeseburger "ALL THE WAY" which includes chili. I am cheese, onions and ketchup all the way. It is a 1/3 lb burger and while they do have a tempting double I went single. The onion are chopped and raw and delicious. The american cheese gooey and binds it all together. Burger was well done but juicy and worth savoring.   I love the wedge fries which you don't see everywhere but what I especially liked is that they were thin wedges with crispy edges. Perfect and as much a reason to come here as any. Of course it is cash only and there is a large picnic tablet to sit at but that is it. Only open until 2. Order, wait for your number, pick up and pay.

jzvBj0Ok6Ecy_umBzATvSA.text: I can see why this place comes highly recommended. The burgers are juicy, the crust is crunch  and the char is just right. The chili is not a tomato based, but highly seasoned and worth getting on their fries. The fries are hand cut.  Even with the chili and cheese, the fries still came through. It is so good that I actually contemplate getting a third burger. Next time I get a day off I will return for another burger or two.

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chili cheese fries
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brooks special without onions

2Rmr6AH1j1FbpjBViIDC2Q.text: Amazing and delicious. Nothing fancy here but I find the best things in life aren't super fancy so it works for me. My husband kept wanting to eat here weeks before our wedding but I refused (while delicious, the food isn't on anyone's pre-wedding diet) so the day after we got back from our honeymoon we stopped here for lunch. It was after two so the window was open but the inside ordering counter wasn't. The fryer stops at 2 pm so no fries (although I've had them before and they're good) but we each got a burger and a soda. Tasty, fresh and comforting! This is a great, local spot that everyone should visit.

OSP2SaJF8hsE-yBcDO8w-Q.text: So per Yelp's suggestion, I came here as a last supper...before starting my vegan diet that get swimsuit ready and boy was it worth it.  I ordered the cheeseburger and hot dog all the way, fries and a sweet tea. In less than 5 minutes my order was up.   Being ravenously hungry, I dug right in.   I tackled the hot dog first. The chili was absolutely divine. I mean so good that you could slather it on cardboard and it would taste delicious. The hot dog wasn't your typical North Carolina red dog (which I genuinely love). It was an elevated meaty dog with a nice rich, beefy, sausage flavor.   The cheeseburger was amazing. Again the chili was the star but the beef was clearly a fresh patty, the cheese was perfectly melted. It was amazing.   The fresh cut wedge fries were perfectly seasoned with seasoned salt and crispy.   All in all a deliciously craveable experience and that you won't regret.

Z0RDv9YApazmxW4Xl7sr1g.text: This place is such a little burger shack, it's amazing and I love it! I'm actually a little bummed that I've lived in Charlotte for 3 years and my first trip was yesterday. It's just a perfectly delicious (and unbelievably messy) burger. There's no frills to it, but it's a delicious, juicy burger and the chili is a simple, classic recipe.   It is cash only, and there are no seats inside (barely any room inside) but find a spot at the picnic table, get into a hunched stance (so you don't get delicious chili on you) and make some new friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheeseburger all the way (mustard, chili, onions) but I went without onions.

gzB8aFgUnJ94KdE2gmGHrw.text: Not much to say about this place that hasn't already been said... I can't believe it took me 30+ years living in Charlotte to finally visit for the tastiest, messiest, grilled to perfection and topped with the perfect trinity -- cheese, onions & chili -- burger joint in town! Go on a gorgeous fall (or spring) day and eat outside next to bankers, city workers and everyone in between. A perfect burger and fries will only set you back about $5 and I promise, you won't be disappointed!   I'll join the masses and selfishly state that I wish they were open on the weekend/evenings.

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outdoor, standup table. Perfect spot to eat on that gorgeous fall day!
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Legendary
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. The spread at their outdoor, standup table.

Vy42xCPgCwZDpsgGXpZVbQ.text: I've been meaning to try this place for quite some time, but they're only open during the week until  about 3 pm. I finally got around to coming though. They serve some really solid burgers here and at a good price. You have to order them all the way with chili, onions and mustard.   I ordered a side of chili cheese fries which disappointed me (at least for the size and the price ratio).   But as far the burgers go - they're bomb. Try them.

BgXXIDs-bMym54o-A0zvCA.text: Best breakfast sandwich I've ever had. Smoked sausage egg and cheese made "all the way".

8n6-t2VYQ-wulJeSXnQAMw.text: BEST Burger in Charlotte...The East Coast...The USA...The WORLD!  Seriously there burgers are amazing and the homemade chili is an absolute must add-on! Cash only, great prices, short hours- all perfect traits for a burger joint only known by Charlotte natives. If you're in the area or live in Charlotte or in the Carolinas for that matter, GO to BROOKS!

AbZGZLRi5kEboaQ3wImAeA.text: I just got back to Charlotte two days ago and was excited that I was about 2 miles from Shake Shack but then I remembered... BROOKS! So I had to drive aaaallll the way to the other side of town but it's always worth it. The only thing missing is offering hot chili peppers or peperoncinis.  Cheeseburger ATW, please!

rw7ZzIab9EmReK3-fjd51Q.text: Simple little spot, smells greasy when you walk in, the burgers taste delicious and are made to perfection. I loved my burger and so did my crew. I will definitely find my way back to this burger joint.  No complaints, only compliments! Keep it up, Sandwich House!

e3xXn3h03uyZeyCFm1-XtA.text: Here I am... I made it! I've been trying to eat the burgers here for years but couldn't make it happen until now! They stop serving food at 2pm, and I have to pick my dog up from the SpayNeuter facility near by at 3, so I ventured out here as early as possible to treat my self. My first mistake was not bringing cash, my second mistake was not checking to see if they had an ATM inside the building. Instead, I walked to the entrance and read the sign on the door "CASH ONLY" - Oops! so I returned to my car defeated. No! I came all this way, I must eat this burger! So I went on an adventure through NoDa looking for an ATM which wasted 20 minutes!  For the record, They DO have an ATM inside.  So I get a burger and hot dog all the way, because that's what you do when you try a local favorite spot; you order the recommended specialties. I did ask to add slaw to my hot dog tho.. anyways... Sadly, despite all my effort - I was not blown away by anything about the food. Perhaps I shall return again and tweak my toppings a little. Maybe then I'll find what the hype is all about. But rest assured, I won't be in any hurry to return.

8sZVXZgjdACuXWeb7a_QDw.text: Looking for a quick delicious burger and cold drink at a very reasonable price, check out this NoDa gem located off of Davidson. Definitely a local delight based on its location, decor & size it's easily missed (looks like an abandoned building after hours).   This little gem produces some good eats and has a very basic menu but quick and friendly service. All burgers are made well done so no special orders but the burgers are delicious. I have an extreme sensitivity to sweets so I normally do not order sweet tea from any where but a customer told me it's a perfect balance of tea & sweet and by the old Gods and new (Game of Thrones reference ) it was delicious and I didn't need to dilute with water so thank you Brooks.  I highly recommend Brooks for anyone who can get there between the hours of 9am-2pm (they serve breakfast) but the grill shuts down promptly at 2pm so get there on time you won't be disappointed.  P.S. You get a little ticket after ordering, your pickup number is after the dash  & you pay when picking up the order not ordering.

BnVgmgJ_SRdqFvrQaVwESg.text: Normally I wouldn't wait 30 mins in the cold for a burger.. I just wouldn't do it and go elsewhere. But too many loyal regulars have made me want to see what the hype is about! So glad I stayed out in the cold. It was worth every single bite! Will be returning very soon!!

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States

IEhkILmvP_m8mYDc0jg7_g.text: Stop by the ATM on the way this place only takes cash, and while you're at it go to the restroom too, they don't have a public option.   But do go, absolutely go and see what the hype is about. Brooks doesn't offer frills, which is perfectly fine because their focus on the food is obvious in the taste! I got a hotdog all the way and added slaw. So good. So, so good! Their burgers are what they're most known for and the chili, get the chili.   It's the right price point to create a habit, too. Oh, and if the weather is nice sit out at the bench and chat with your neighbor...for me, that's part of the appeal.

sidK3MAJEofkGcLJ6LnYUw.text: I ordered a cheeseburger all the way and a hot dog all the way.  Food was ready real quick, was very good and the price can't be beat. As much as I liked both, I will say Chubz has a slightly better chili cheeseburger IMO but no complaints from me, I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States

5_Dcy7GGQpSciG4CUsHrPA.text: It's another edition of Corey and his Wife's local Charlotte  eating journey. Another Charlotte staple, Brooks Sandwich house. Brooks has a great southern burger. Not too many bells and whistles, just a simple, delicious burger. You can get a single or a double with many usual burger fixings such as onion, cheese, and bacon.  They are also known for their chili. You can get that by the pound or on top of your burger. Their burgers are tasty and decadent. Their fries are simple and good... not great, but they go well with the burger. They have other things like breakfast options, hot dogs and chicken sandwiches, but I can't bring myself to cheat on the burger with anything else. The set up is simple and the nostalgic. The staff are friendly and inviting.  If you have never tried them, do so now. The fryer turns of at 2 pm so, you don't have all day to get the full menu. They can be really busy at times and there is no dine in area. Be prepared to either eat at the outside picnic area, your car, back at home or your office. However, wherever you take it, you are going to enjoy it.

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Single burger all the way
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fries and bacon double burger

X78DE7R2zPkQQwWDpsehRA.text: Amazing burgers & (in my opinion) the BEST french fries in Charlotte-hands down. If you want fries-be sure to get there before 2pm because they turn the fryer off an hour before closing.

bzdP-R_-5f5vSnXyd8TPCg.text: Bring cash and ENJOY!  This place offers standing room only, a historic pot of chilly bowling and a great Carolina Classic. Definitely a gem amongst a skyline of up and coming fad eateries.  Continue to support establishments like this one. They are what made Charlotte and should not be forgotten.

VAZUmHDp724hBddOEDjAYg.text: Went for my first time to Brooks after seeing it on TV.  The burger is just ok and average at best.  I ordered a double chili cheeseburger and fries.  I didn't taste anything that screamed best burger in Charlotte.  It's a decent burger.  Meat was moist.  Chili was hardly notable in the entire meal.  Especially shocking after everyone screamed how amazing it was.  Fries soggy and lacked flavor.  I can't fathom how this was voted best burger in all of Charlotte unless it just gets the hometown vote.  Service was quick.  Honestly, if you want to have a burger that truly tastes amazing there are several restaurants that will blow Brooks away.  I probably would not recommend here if someone asked me to recommend an amazing burger in Charlotte.

hFNbNmEfbZtBjLVBSQu_sw.text: What a treat this place is! I've been meaning to try it for awhile but I'm not really one to carry cash on me. Luckily they have an ATM on site. This place is no frills, grab and go. There is an outdoor stand up eating area though if you need to eat there. I got the cheeseburger which was great. It was Charred the way I like itX I also grabbed some chili cheese fries. They were great! Loaded with chili and cheese. Made to order so it takes a while but the stuff comes out piping hot. It was so delicious greasy and perfect. I will be back and my waistline will hate me for it!

cAL5hkUOlbAqEPUz4RURxQ.text: We are from Raleigh and don't ever get down to Charlotte on a weekday. We finally had a chance and decided to try Brooke's since we had heard so much about it. The chili was really good but overall we were under impressed. We love hole in the wall hamburger places but thought the burgers were just ok. Hotdog was better than the burger because you could taste the chili more. The people taking the orders could have been a little more personable. Prices were excellent!

KkLGoo_ddg4ioQWts_qL9g.text: Flavorful home style burger. Have to it all the way. Good value too only 4 bucks!! You'll miss it if you are not paying attention,right off the rail line. Only open till 3 during the week but it's worth the trip.

0THC2MaBazqLddjd719iAQ.text: We went here during lunch time, ordering a double burger, a single burger and a hot dog. I asked for my chili on the side, as I was unsure if I would like it enough to eat it on my burger. I was charged $1.50 for the chili on the side(but was already charged for it on the burger). I however did not realize this until after leaving. The burgers were greasy but still on the dry side. The chili was SUPER greasy. It actually ruined the shirt I had on upon my very first bite. The service was fast and the people were pretty friendly but I'm unsure if I'd return in the f

EDq2a9ZVFrjN5MajPNC8eQ.text: The best burgers ever.  Found this place a few years when I worked near there.  Their Breakfast sandwiches are the bomb too.  And reasonably priced

VJa5fDJCH2yYgz0hx_AePw.text: Food is amazing a hidden gem. Nice little mom and pop joint. Small but the food is huge.

gkLeQeONnKE2T-dRvzy9EQ.text: Had to try it since I've heard so many good things. MMM MMM. First, it's cheap. Cash only. I got a double burger all the way (chili, cheese, onions, mustard), fries and a drink. Came to be about 7.50. Don't judge me on the double either.. I'm pregnant and I ate the entire thing!!  So good. Really homemade, juicy, flavorful. I thought it would be overwhelmingly full of chili but it wasn't, the chili was like a condiment and it was the perfect amount. Even if you don't like chili on a burger i would recommend you try this one! Also the fries were great and the line was extremely fast and efficient. Obviously it's not healthy, but that's not why you're here.  ALSO...plenty of parking which I was surprised about!

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. preggers enjoying the massive double cheeseburger. Not my best look...but I&#39;m happy okay?!

GQ8mTaNqsuSPAinKgwkM0A.text: This is a burger place, with underwhelming food. Some other items that did not affect my rating as much as the food: no seating, long wait time at lunch, cash only. I have tried this restaurant twice and had similar experiences both times.  I have no idea why so many people like this place.

8sTLRihHCFnmc-Emp5yy0w.text: Yes, this burger is amazing.  I got mine with onions and chili on top.  You should note, that it's not really chili.... it's more like seasoned meat, the consistency of what you would find inside a taco. I bought 2 1lb tubs of chili not knowing this, thinking I was buying a soup and ended up having to buy Wendy's chili to mix with it.  One "chili" I actually used as the ground beef filling for homemade empanadas. I also got the chili fries and really didn't care for them.  Drinks in a can are $1 and everything is served on paper plates.  2 long picnic tables outside if you want to stand or sit down to eat.  Restaurant accepts cash only.

hiGIDL8AiTzlie2IiWFIWw.text: Ok...this is not my place.  I have been here twice and really have never liked anything.  I know, it's almost 5 stars..but this is just my opinion.  I will say, everyone I know has enjoyed it, from breakfast sandwiches to burgers.  I just didn't fall in love.  It's not open on weekends, so you have to plan accordingly.  The shop is tiny inside and you order your food to go.  It is clean inside.  The staff is nice and the orders come out quickly.  Just not my taste. And that's ok.  I haven't a bad experience otherwise, and have heard many great things.

4tA-dMVuYlHsdQD0HE5I_g.text: Don't come here expecting unlimited fries or towering burgers served with onion straws & guacamole, Brook's serves up affordable and flavorful burgers, hand pattied and packed with flavor from that 50 year old griddle!   Have it your way as long as your way is pretty darn basic but freaking awesome with Brooks famous chili, onion, mustard, and cheese, and oh yeah no freaking ketchup on the burger. The only thing worse than serving ketchup on a burger are the lines at Brooks Sandwich House because everyone knows where to get a great burger.  You wont need a second mortgage for a Brooks burger either, a Cheeseburger all the way will set you back less than $4.   Forget the Zack's "Not So Special", been there not impressed, frozen stamped patty of meat on a cold bun.   Food: 5 Sporks Service:  4 Sporks Atmosphere: 5 Sporks (love that parking lot) Local Beer: 0 Sporks (walk across the street to Heist Brewery) Value: 5 Sporks

-vWjtbE9pS-94LzxUIIO5Q.text: CASH ONLY! Outside seating only. Breakfast & Lunch only. Only one! A Charlotte icon. Long line; quick service. One of the best burgers in the QC!

ILwA5Qlcfa9VfdjbwTZKHA.text: Oh my gosh , yesterday was my first time I ever ate here. But Lordy I am stuck like chuck forever. I had the cheeseburger and hotdog with a coconut pie. I will be back there soon.

m_483jWC6_Mh8H0MqTuqLg.text: I love this place for a good cheap lunch.  The burger all the way is awesome.   Fries are good as well.   Hotdogs are pretty good but the burger is the way to go.  The building is a real dive and standing at a table outside to eat is a little different but this just adds to the experience.   If you've never tried this place its a must.

FVsZ_3G39EXG7GGw0bugMg.text: TLDR: Brooks Sandwich House delivers great burgers for a great price. If you consider the taste of their menu items and divide that by the price, you'll learn quickly that Brooks is one of the most valuable restaurants in Charlotte.  I will echo what every other reviewer suggests, you should get the burger all the way. Well, really, get anything you want but be sure to get it all the way.

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burger and hot dog all the way

PBQ4TUZNDkgRa8t0DfTZ2g.text: Everyone was saying that some of the best burgers in town was at Brooks, so I had to check them out.  I must say I was satisfied! The burger itself had a lot of flavor. I got a single Patty with cheese, bacon, and the works. Delicious! Everything worked together to compliment each other, and the service was pretty fast. I was nervous that there would be a line out of the door, but I did go at 8 am (this place is perfect for my work schedule because I get off during breakfast time but never seem to want breakfast).  Rated individually:  Burger: 4/5 Fries: 2.5-3/5  The fries were my least favorite part of the meal just because I like medium to skinny fries. These fries were more like wedges, but they still got the job done.  I paid $8 for my burger and fries, which I think is pretty standard. I would definitely come here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Inside of Brooks
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fries
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Single burger with cheese, bacon, lettuce, tomato, onions, ketchup, and mayo.

aWVkwKvedByRcpm5MXKvBw.text: sometimes life is easy: If they're buying what you're selling, keep selling it. there's plenty worse things to be than predictable. like closed. closed is worse. never want to be closed unless the plan is to re-open tomorrow. the way I count nearly 50 years of opening again tomorrow is a pretty good run. and at 7:04 there's a cluster of folks with sacks o' food yapping under the canopy as I wander in, look at the board, figure out how this works and what's available and do I want pie with that? no pie, just a sandwich all the way, hand over the cash and find a quiet spot to wait for it... pull in at the shop and set to unwrapping my prize. nothing fancy here, substantial slab o' grilled meat on a fried egg topped with chili and cheese and onions with a bit of mustard. a most satisfactory sandwich that held together nicely without many grip changes and my heart barely hurt at all ;-) yea!

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. bologna all tarted-up plus coffee and palmier
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. sausage, egg, and cheese plus browns
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. yep

E5dfKus3GZsu5C52oBOanA.text: I gave this place a shot...twice. Both times the all the way burger which I heard so much about was not even average. It was flat out awful!   I love hole in the wall burger places and love to support local businesses, but this place does not deserve the hype.  The burger is not an actual patty, it's ground up meat that goes everywhere with little to no flavor or taste. I took a picture and it looked like something I found in a garbage. Not even worth showing, but trust me, save your $4.  The people working had as much personality as a mannequin. Pains me to say, but this place may be one of the most overrated in the Queen City.  You couldn't pay me to return.

QXcGNUUHDKiaS0GT81ua7w.text: I finally tried the burger and fries at Brooks. I ordered the single cheeseburger all the way (topped with mustard, chili, and onions) and small fries.   I expected to be wowed after everything I've heard about this place, but it was just ok. It's a good amount of food and a neat experience, so I recommend everyone coming at least once.   They also have hot dogs and fried pies (store bought, not made in-house).  It's cash only, but they have an atm inside in case you forget.

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Covered table outside
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Order inside
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States

KypFM982MCN-gpk4UaHJJg.text: This has been on my list for so long now. It's a challenge to get there though since they are only open during the week for lunch. We had off on Good Friday, so I took the opportunity to go.   It's cash only, but they have an atm inside if you don't come with cash. There's no seating inside and a couple of picnic tables outside. This is really a no frills hole in the wall place which I love.   We got their burger with cheese all the way (chili, onions, and mustard) which is what they're known for. We also tried a hot dog all the way and chili cheese fries. The burger was definitely my favorite. The hot dog was good, but you just can't top the burger. The fries were really good, the cheese was crispy and delicious.   This is definitely a must try in Charlotte. If I worked in the area, this would be a frequent lunch destination.

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chili cheese fries
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burger all the way
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hot dog all the way

ZYFVhLa7hMl9l_DSPgETUQ.text: Burgers and dogs, no frills, cheap and easy.  I am such a huge fan of Brooks Sandwich House. I love their chili. I'm not a huge french fry person, so for me I order a burger with a side of chili dog. I do enjoy their fries though, they are more like potato wedges. You can also get them slathered in chili and cheese. There's a few other sandwich options like a BLT, livermush, bologna, fish filet, etc. You can get breakfast til 10:30am. There's also an option to order their chili and slaw by the pound.  There is no indoor seating. You order at the counter and wait for your number to be called. There's a few outdoor tables. If you're not down to sit outside, then plan to eat in your car (you'll see several people doing this) or take it to go.   Important things to note: they are open Monday through Friday 7am-3pm and closed on the weekends. They are cash only, but there is an ATM on the premises.

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Squad goals

AC-9qN9yCr9cQp-CW6uoFA.text: BEST BURGER IN CHARLOTTE!!! There is always a line out the door so jump in line and don't let it scare you away. Reasonably priced and delicious. I had the pleasure of introducing my mother to Brooks Sandwich House. She's a Charlotte native and had never been. (That's a local crime) she loved it. The burger is delicious. Just go already and stop reading this review! Go! Now!

fwITwDx0MSmhMMj3OEa7UQ.text: Just a good old fashioned burger spot. That's really all there is to it. Cheeseburger all the way is probably what you've heard about, and that's what you should get your first time around.   Cash only, but super cheap. A burger and soda for less than $5. Excited to go back and try out some other items on the menu. Just make sure you go on a nice day, no indoor seating, but picnic tables abound.

_2vNaJLESUBYOBF7ySew7A.text: I finally got to try the famous Brooks Sandwich House. I had been scouting this place out for quite a while. After giving it a try, I must say that I was a bit disappointed. I ordered the double cheese burger all the way, a hot dog all the way, as well, and fries.   The staff was awesome. They were fast, accurate, and friendly. With this being my first time I was unsure of where to stand while I waited for my order. I ended up holding up the wall by the ATM. In retrospect this wasn't a good idea because space is VERY limited inside.   It did not take very long before I received my food. It smelled wonderful. After a short drive home, it was time to partake. After unwrapping everything the burger and the hot dog looked delightfully messy. I tasted the burger first. It tasted a bit dry; even with the chili and mustard. Then I tried the hot dog. It was good but I wasn't wowed. Maybe my expectations were too high.  With this place being a Charlotte staple, definitely give them a try. My tastes aren't your tastes and this place has been around for a very long time. I think I will be back but this time I will try different toppings.

PU2Fgp4QQH9wEdkMqzEJgA.text: I love Brooks. I am born & raised in CHARLOTTE & this one of those hole in the wall treasures. The food is amazing  one of the best burgers in Charlotte. You gotta get your burger & hot dogs "All the way" that's the only way to do it! Better get there early though because they close at like 3pm & you must have CASH!!!!!! They do have a ATM on site too.

YRUueNWhPQ00HMW1_REiGg.text: After reading about this place today I decided to go experience it for myself...Everything said is True!  Awesome no frills burger.  Friendly service... Cash Only... Picnic style dining... Apparently they had to go up on prices a bit - but its still reasonably priced. If you want to experience Brooks Sandwich House I strongly suggest going soon... The overdevelopment of this area is within a stone's throw of this business.... Unfortunately.

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

ezZK3wMbhwBsIflyniSveg.text: Brooks' is legendary. I've eaten here countless times, and it's always phenomenal. I hope this place outlives me. Pro-tip: but a hash brown patty on your sausage, egg and cheese then douse it with yellow mustard.

Nn7yBssh7iLzIwTqXg9PvA.text: A no nonsense take on burgers. The place epitomizes five. With room only for about 6 customers inside, this place gets you in and out quickly, along with a great tasting burger.  This was my second time here and it was exactly like the first. Blue collar, white collar and millionaires all waiting to get in to grab a Brooks Sandwich.  Open the door slowly, because more than likely there is someone on the other pressed against the wall waiting to order. It took me around 10 minutes to order and 3 minutes to get my food. Great! The burger is delicious and worth the trouble driving through "Construction Central" aka NoDa. One day I hope to wait long enough to take a picture of the food.  Definitely recommend!!

XAW2EE9GChQOgCqzgQ1KwQ.text: Oh, how I wish this spot were open on the weekends. Awesome burger and fry stand, no frills, super cheap. It's a must try if you're in the area on a weekday in NODA.

lg04k7-GrLng80MfAc2FfQ.text: This is one of my favorite places for a burger. The burgers remind me of home. They are cooked like homemade burgers in a cast iron pan. The service is also friendly and don't expect to sit down unless you are dining outside. CASH only. They have an ATM just in case you forget your cash. Great selections of breakfast sandwiches and lunch sandwiches. You can also get can sodas and fries. During the morning they have hash browns as a side. I've visited this place for years. They are nestled in the corner of the North Davidson (NoDa) area of Charlotte. You order and can wait outside for your number to be called. The new light rail system is in walking distance along with other shops and restaurants. Brooks stands alone in a red brook building with the name Brooks on it. If you are looking for a hometown burger, try Brooks! They have been voted best in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hamburger with cheese $4.25
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outside of Brooks
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hot dog all the way

1gfCCcZ2PwDog9rznIA3zg.text: Just a home run joint s far as I'm concerned. We read the Charlotte paper and since we are new to town we decided to go try it. NoDa looks like a cool neighborhood but Brooks is such a quirky place, sort of a shack with wood tables across the street from luxury condos, we felt like this was food heaven.   We were standing in line and two women came up to look at the menu beside the window. A guy who had obviously been there a million times YELLS at them "Hey, whatever you get, get it with the chili on it or you're and IDIOT!" I almost spit I laughed so hard. But it was so True.  We didn't deviate; two cheeseburgers all the way (chili, mustard and onions) and fries. Brooks is now a place we will go out of our way to run by and grab lunch.

idb4E850EZPCz-xfE2tvhw.text: Great food.  I absolutely love "hole in the wall" places and this is right... I feel like it was the core of the city. As a visitor, I overheard some of the customers complaining of the price increase... But they keep coming back, so I guess it is not too much of a problem! I will revisit when we are in town again!

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States

OVo_i4M6xhlTC5ZWCLzdCQ.text: I heard about this place a couple years back but never ventured out for lunch until yesterday. I had the Cheeseburger "All the Way" with fries. If you're looking for a delicious messy burger, this is the place to go.   It's not hard to find, you just wouldn't think to look for it. They only take cash but they have an atm just inside the door. And they don't have seating. There's enough space inside for a handful of people to put in their orders then, you stand to eat outside. I believe there might be some benches but I didn't pay attention.   I will most likely return and tell my friends about it!

8ENLvwro9msu_t9G6AdoCA.text: Finally  made it. Been on my "to do" list for years.  This place has always gotten excellent reviews on their Dogs, Burgers, and Sandwiches but I have never had an opportunity to try them. That is till today.  My problem is that they are only open 7 am to 3 pm, Monday through Friday and closed on weekends.  Not normally in Charlotte at these times and if I am, I'm on a tight schedule and with little reason to be in the same area as the restaurant.  Then we have today.  Had Hip Replacement Surgery on Wednesday and was discharged at around 1 pm. Elizabeth to NoDa is not that far so off we went.  Found out real quick there were some street closures and detours because of the Blue Line Lynx extension so pay attention and pay attention to signs.  Since I am on a walker and crutches, my wife went up to the window and ordered lunch. Not completely sure what she had but I had the Chili Dog and the Basic Cheeseburger.  Both were delicious.  The dog was plump and juicy and Chili full of meat and great flavor. By full of meat, I mean not as runny as most commercial chili you tend to get out of a can and they type that other dog places try to imitate  People like to think of a Gourmet Burger or Cheeseburger in terms of all the exotic things that can be added. They can be good but get away from what a Gourmet Cheeseburger Burger should be.  A Gourmet Cheeseburger should be as simple as possible with a good fresh pattie cooked properly and neither dry or greasy. Cheese should something that compliments the meat and does not distract, Then of course, you have you have the other topping of lettuce and tomatoes which should be a fresh as possible and tomatoes should be properly ripe. Bun should be fresh and condiments should be used sparingly to avoid overwhelming the simple tastes that each component contributes. Mayonnaise is good and a very mild mustard used sparingly are good choices.  Final potential topping is the onion. Some people like them, some don't. I like a slice of a good sweet onion to add a bit of texture to the burger so long as it's of the sweet type.  Brooks pulled it off.  The Chili Dog and the Cheeseburger were both worth their reputation and if I was to name a favorite, it would be the Cheeseburger.  Take note that the roads are messed up with Blue Line Extension but good news is that they are now only short walking distance to one of the stations

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sign
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Front
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States

F5x0YnFIgryq840HO465OA.text: You know how long I've been wanting to try this place?!  LONG OVERDUE!  Finally I got to try the famous Brooks burger last week for lunch. My $3.50 cheeseburger all-the-way (onion, chili & mustard, I asked for slaw on top of it at no extra charge) was well worth every penny. The single pattie was grilled to a slight crisp on the outside but retained a good balance of juicy meat flavor with a hint of seasoning. Everything else added on made it a filling portion (at least for me). The menu board was short and sweet, the only side item was fries basically... which wasn't anything special.  The whole eating under the outdoor hut/shed structure standing up along a wood slab table with everyone added to the experience. There will be many Brooks lunch outing in the future... I may have to give other items a try.  Tips to eating at Brooks: 1.Don't wear white... or anything light color, especially if you doing all the way southern style. 2. Lettuce and tomato cost extra, but seriously, stick with chili and onion and slaw... you're in the South, enjoy the perk 3. May not be a bad idea to bring some wet naps 4. As you may know already, CASH only, so bring them

mEychE_8BWw184tACjV5eg.text: Classic, must visit spot for a cheap lunch! Don't change a thing....just order straight from the menu. These guys have perfected it all :)

HGCEpySEx9gkBG_e-v4xzw.text: There's a reason why this place has been voted Charlotte's best burger year after year. No frills. No board telling you where your fries came from. No secret menu. Just a counter and great burgers served up Carolina style (chili, mustard, onions). The prices are amazing and you can't beat the taste. Don't worry about finding a seat because Brooks is take out only. There are some picnic areas to eat outside, but you will find many patrons taking in the great taste of the real Brooks brothers in their car. Don't miss one of Charlotte's best greasy landmarks.  Biggest tip is that it is cash only. If you didn't make a trip to the ATM machine, there is one in the ordering area.

6OlkR5ePbNro9qL8EYg-DQ.text: It's the type of joint you really root for. You want them to succeed and don't want them to sell out.   Ordered the cheeseburger "all the way," (w/chili) fries and a sweet tea (anytime Uncle Si has one in his hand, I just crave it). I think we both agreed that the burger could have been seasoned a bit more, even with the chili. The fries were ok. The value, though, was GREAT.   I would bring some handwipes with you if you eat in your car like we did.   The staff is really nice and friendly, huge plus!

6Xi72UgCOCa3tQb4tEOzPw.text: It was pretty good food, but I wouldn't say the best in charlotte.  The 96 health inspection score was a little disturbing.  They definitely could improve the customer throughput.  Prices were comparable to other similar places.

pe4Wsoph6PLTsymjC8jE1A.text: I have little to say but to just do it. Breakfast egg n bacon . soft bun. Runny egg. Lunch the burger with chili n cheese extra chili. You can't go wrong. OK I have had two breakfast sandwiches. Only cause as soon as you leave off the gravel you want more. Trust me.

9CSKf56ETBkorn-8tS04kA.text: Best burger in Charlotte! No where to sit except outside picnic tables, but the burger and chili are dynamite.

v9EIjt2uwrKBGIBBOcSSeg.text: And finally it was my turn to try this place.  As soon as I entered I recalled that I had actually been here before but it was years ago and I think actually ran by a different set of owners....not sure though.  I had the bacon cheeseburger and it was mouthwatering good.  I loved every bite of it.  To rank this the number one burger joint in the area isn't a large stretch but I have to say it's a different kind of burger, yes delicious, but not creative, etc.  Meh, that's fine with me but just so you know.    Standing room only and cash only!

CCsR7SK-aubRfkrOnuQ2JA.text: Always packed but who cares. The burgers and dogs are great. Type of place you can recommend to anyone and look like a genius.

VjXb8u75qA88mU2IqtlolQ.text: neighbor and I go here once a month.  cheeseburger all the way, stand outside to eat at the table.  good food, fun place especially when nice outside.

ZVVbjXt7ACMDD6MIumiwoQ.text: Love this place. No gourmet burger here...so if that's what you're looking for then move on (I'd suggest Bricktop's burger for that). This is just a good old fashioned straight to the point burger. I order a cheeseburger "all the way" (mustard, onions and chili). Delicious and extremely messy! They have no where to sit, but they do have a table that you can stand up and eat at outside. Makes you feel like you're some sort of animal but I don't even care. I usually end up just eating in the car if it's particularly hot outside. Sweet tea is good. Don't even ask for unsweet tea. My mom made this mistake and the lady responded with: "WE AINT GOT NO UNSWEET TEA". Haha...still makes me laugh to this day. Great lunch place, give it a try.

7idr_MybF-jYbHKkgL0eng.text: You really can't beat the price at Brooks. It is definitely a unique experience for any burger lover. Grab your cash (cash only) and make sure it's the middle of the afternoon on a weekday (limited operating hours) and call your order in ahead of time if you don't want to wait too long.   Brooks is a teeny tiny little spot - once you enter it almost reminds you of a under-the-tent church cookout or something along those lines. You will be squeezed in with a bunch of hungry patrons and be prepared to eat outside or take it to go as there is zero room to eat inside.   Now all of these stipulations to eating do not in fact make the experience more aggravating- in fact, it is quite the opposite. You can't help but feel the excitement in the air, and perhaps a bit of drool on your arm thanks to the guy smushed next to you. Regardless, your burger will be juicy, tasty, and cheap!  I recommend the cheeseburger all the way (onions, mustard, and chili)!

7W5EiKf2qXu3ql7FOw-n3Q.text: One of those businesses that do what they do best they are not fancy or clean but the food and prices are hard to beat. A nice little place full of locals that appear to stop often as I also find myself doing.

IFqam_YSB4PBaUiHf8-4DA.text: Pretty mediocre burgers and previously frozen french fries.  Ok for a quick stop and on par with some fast food chains.  Would never call it the "Best Burger in Charlotte".

5-INtPp16kscxA_rb5feYg.text: First time at Brooks. I had two cheeseburgers and I have to say I am looking forward to bringing friends and family here. The cheeseburger "All the way" was fabulous!  Topped with a thick peppery chili, mustard and onions on a fresh steamed bun.   The second burger with more traditional toppings was great too. Funny little building where you walk in to order then eat outside or in you car.  Steady flow of customers at 1:30 on a Wednesday. I like the place!!!

r-KsKkjst-JmUUBgYLLCxw.text: Charlotte institution. Fries are mediocre but the burgers are top notch. Make sure to get it with chili and bring cash.

2Y-1CDlqmqTVO74EJ4RYvQ.text: National hot dog day up in heeuh.  Great burger & dog.  Would've added more onion, pickle and mustard but it was pretty awesome as is.  Nowhere to stand when packed and I don't think there was anywhere to wash your hands afterwards so you need to bring your A game to tackle the carolina style goods.

wME_dincnfzlsLslJFFSTw.text: Hands down best chili burger in Charlotte. Great mix of people and the owners are great.
