adiFMmPAve89DkbvjmXcEQ.text: I've been  eating here over 30 years, long before it became fashionable on the edge of modern yuppievillle. Wonderful family that makes great food. This place is a part of Charlotte history.

AVot-e94fUio6vonN4Y7UA.text: Brooks is tiny, hidden and absolutely freakin' delicious.  For a mere $4.75 you too can enjoy a thick, tasty cheeseburger and a bag of substantial (both in length and girth) fries. Generally, I'm not a fry picker but by the time I got back to work I had picked away at least half my fries. Yes, they were a tad cold, but so what? The burgers were crisp on the outside and full of flavor. I love that they shred their lettuce and onions so you never end up with one little thin slice of lettuce or a bite that only tastes like onion.  The owners are super friendly, but in a way that doesn't slow the service. (You can't afford to when your waiting area is smaller than some closets.) Watch out waistline, there is a new choice on my regular lunch rotation and it's Brooks for burgers.

bpAXNvqRqtrj02PUtosO9A.text: So there's this burger joint in a block house with metal bar windows, a gravel parking lot and it sits adjacent to a railroad yard. There's a standing room only outdoor eating area comprised of aged wood and rusty nails. There's beef, chili, American cheese slices, hot dogs and bologna inside. My kind of place!  Bottom line is the food is out of sight. Southern style all the way. Get a burger and don't by any means miss the wedge fries served in their paper pocket with grains of salt clinging on. Ranks up there with the top 3 fries I've had, lots of flaky potato flavor to go along with you chili, mustard and slaw. Place your order, pay with cash and get out of the way and outside so you can cozy up next to lawyers, sanitation workers, hobos and railroad track gangs alike. They all know what's good and where to find it.   These brothers have been doing the flat top gig for decades and the lot is always full at lunch for a reason. Get here!

E1c3Iktux92szft22dHWDQ.text: THE BEST CAROLINA CLASSIC BURGER ON PLANET EARTH!   - Ridiculously small restaurant: SRO. - Take-out only.  - CASH ONLY.   - Hours: PLEASE NOTE: Brooks is only open from 7:30 AM until 2:00 PM. They lock the door at 1:00 PM, but the tiny take out window, to the left of the entrance is open until 2 o'clock PM. I found this out the hard way.....  - Seating: There are no seats inside or outside the restaurant. There are elevated communal wooden tables in the shade of trees.   - Parking: There is a generous amount of parking in their gravel lot.   - Conclusion: Their ATW burgers are SERIOUSLY good!   - PS: One time, after returning back to work, I took a ruler and measured the thickness of the hamburger patties, AFTER being cooked. One burger was fully one inch thick and the other burger was 7/8" - amazing.   - PSS: Ordering their burger "all the way," is the ONLY way to get the maximum goodness of mustard, chili, and onion atop their THICK, hand formed, never frozen, hamburger patties.   - PSSS: If Brooks would put CHILI CHEESE FRIES on their menu, they would make a fortune. Their fries are normally super crispy, skin on, and salty. Their homemade chili is out of this world. Top this with a liberal application of Velveeta  or Cheese Whiz melted cheese. You could sell these for $3 per container, as fast as you could make them.

31JojRDGP26z9qfV9sfPFg.text: Located in the NoDa area just outside of Uptown Charlotte, Brooks Sandwich House has been in operation since the 1970's and remains as authentic today as it has for decades. On the inside you'll find there's no seating, no "real" ordering line, no fancy decor, or anything else that resembles your average restaurant  Instead you walk in the front door and are immediately standing in the kitchen with only a counter between you and Brooks' World Famous Burgers.  After carefully considering what to get on our first trip and a little persuasion from the staff we decided to go for a bacon cheeseburger, a bacon cheeseburger "all the way", a hot dog "all the way", french fries, and a sweat tea. One of the things that Brooks' is best know for is their chili. Its pretty much considered an atrocity to dine at Brooks' without getting chili on something. Brooks' World Famous Chili is even being sold at your local Harris Teeter... that's how important this stuff is.   So after a few minutes of waiting and looking around, we realized just how much Brooks' reminded us of our favorite burger joint in Lynchburg "Texas Inn" aka the "T" Room. The rustic, authentic, local, anti-glamour type of foodie hangout that makes non-locals easy to point out. Then we got our food and headed outside to find out if Brooks' was all hype.. or whether or not locals had been on to something for the last few decades.  Brooks' lacks a lot of the creature comforts traditional to most restaurants but it doesn't seem to damper anybody's craving for their mouthwatering and handcrafted burgers. We walked outside and quickly realized we had four options  1- Bring the food home 2 - Eat in our car 3 - Eat on our car 4 - Eat at the long wooden table in the shade  It was an absolutely beautiful day so we chose to take full advantage of the quality lighting and setup on the hood of our super fancy Pontiac Grand Am.   To say the food looked too good to take pictures would be an understatement. All I could think of was how quickly I wanted to get the photos out of the way so my teeth could sink deep into the handcrafted and perfectly cooked hamburger patty topped with cheese, bacon, onions, chili, and mustard. Love at first bite is the best way to describe our experience at Brooks'. After a few minutes of the HOT.. HOT.. HOT sun beating down on us we sought out refuge in the shade and relocated our grub to the long wooden table behind the restaurant.  After consuming every last bite and taking a long hard look from an outsiders perspective of the restaurant and the claim of being "Home of the World's Best Burger"... we decided it fell a little shy of the high expectation we had at the beginning. It was love at first bite and we would definitely recommend it to any foodie looking to get a taste of Charlotte's history. But with that aside... it was not "Home of the World's Best Burger". Instead we found it to be home of a really good and fresh made piece of Charlotte burger bliss.

UfSuFa7sgAd8a-yGmMS_Ew.text: Cash only! I like to note that for people, since I usually travel without cash. ...Yep, this place rocks. The burgers are simply phenomenal for the price!!! And the girls inside are helpful and friendly. I went at lunch, and it was pretty packed, but I still had my food in a hurry.

LvjtMXOuNVD40QfAzTmwMw.text: I'm kicking myself now that I found this place because I've been working in NoDa for 4 years and could've been eating these burgers all along...better late than never I guess!   I instantly fell in love with Brooks because I love Hole-in-the-wall type places and this is definitely one of those. From my experience, when you take away all the unnecessary frills, you are left with something delicious and cheap, and that is really all that matters in life. I've had their chicken sandwich, fries, and burgers, and the burgers are by far the star. I always get them with cheese all the way, which includes mustard, onions, and their homemade chili for $3.50. One of the things I love most about their burgers, other than the taste, is the fact that although they do pack a large amount of chili in there, it is not a complete disaster when you eat it and you can actually safely eat them while driving! (layer some napkins on your lap for extra insurance!)  It sucks that we can't eat their burgers 24/7, but I respect the fact that they're a family owned business and need to take some time for themselves.

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burger Heaven! Burger with cheese all the way (mustard, onions, and chili)!

-ONbwJ91Z7wsnL7WNjaVVw.text: Brooks is that hole in the wall, off the beaten path Mecca.  There is no accidently finding it, you have to be going there.  It is a tiny  walk up counter, pretty smoky from the exhaust.  Simple breakfast items, burgers and dogs. Everything is wrapped in that heavenly white paper.  No tables and chairs, only one long table outside. A very fun visit to fulfill the chowhound in you. Brooks is one of those special places that you need to go at least once.  Cash only, closes 2p in the afternoon.

photos.caption: Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Brooks Sandwich House - Charlotte, NC, United States

hQBNrzqwtDk8iBSHBXYnBg.text: I really enjoy this little hole in the wall sandwich shop!! I can tell its a family-owned business and they are always very pleasant when I come through no matter if its breakfast or lunch! If you need a grease fix this is the place to be :)

qwj14JwlVL0MbOnfxLIiGw.text: What a great Charlotte landmark, the burger was pretty good but the hot dog was really good, it was the chili, fries were pretty tasty, the staff are extremely friendly, just wish they would clean the place up and the parking lot pick up some trash, probably a 2 1/2 star, but I would recommend the place

JtGl9ISqxeIK9LWsopG6nA.text: Holy Moses. If you live in Charlotte or anywhere close by, you MUST visit Brooks. I love burgers and this place is amazing. I had the cheese burger with lettuce and tomato and chili cheese fries. Outstanding. The only thing missing is a runny egg to go on top!

_o3_ebEGIiuEhxwVbyC2MA.text: A solid burger and fries at a decent price and nothing more here in my opinion.  I stopped in at around 11:30 hoping to be a little before the lunch rush (if there is any at Brooks- I'm not really sure), and I ordered the cheeseburger all the way combo with fries. I have to say that I was surprised at the location to begin with- I didn't expect a lot, but I didn't realize it's essentially a shack with no place to sit and eat (and barely enough space to stand in line). Despite only ordering a burger and fries, it took 8-10 minutes for the food to get done even though only 2 other orders were ahead of me, so I would recommend ordering ahead.  As for the burger, it was good but not great. It came with standard bun, pretty high quality beef patty, a slice of unheated American cheese, some chili, and LOTS of onions and mustard. I'm glad I really like mustard or it may have been too much, and the plethora of raw onions wasn't ideal but also wasn't bad. I would've prefer the onions grilled but they were still decent on the sandwich. The chili added no real flavor, however, and honestly I wouldn't have been able to distinguish it taste-wise from the beef patty. The single cheese slice was lost with all the onions and mustard and didn't provide much flavor either. Overall, it was a good, greasy burger for only $3.75 and was definitely a step up from fast food burgers. For a fairly long wait time (or the inconvenience of having to order ahead) I would probably rather go to a Five Guys and pay slightly more for a larger burger where I can get the toppings I want.

MVv3UjyMbwd5cNOSEQ00XQ.text: Small little hole-in-the-wall place that's right behind the Highland Mills Lofts in NoDa. No seating inside (there are some wooden tables outside to stand and eat) and CASH ONLY.   Had heard a lot about this place but never could find myself around the area when it was open until yesterday. There was a line when I came in around 12pm as well as people already eating outside. Ordered a cheeseburger all-the-way (chili, mustard, and onion) and added bacon with coleslaw. Since this was my first time and I wasn't sure when I'd be back, I splurged and ordered the chili cheese fries too.  The burger - delicious! I personally enjoy a burger the most when I feel like the patty is big enough to fill you (and the bun) up but not so big that you need to cut it in half. Was it nice and pretty? Definitely not but it tasted great. When I come back, I'll probably hold the bacon only because it added a salty taste which was good but took away from the flavoring of the burger, chili, mustard and slaw. Again, with the burger being a great size, the chili really complimented everything. It was barely messy at all and you could taste all the toppings.   Chili cheese fries - they were good, not great. Lots of grease from the chili and cheese which was expected. I could barely see any cheese on the fries though. If their chili wasn't so great, I would have probably docked a star but I would have been happy with just chili on the fries. I'm glad I got to experience first-hand how great this burger place does chili :)   I'm definitely coming back!

u3F2FljBMHAAElUmE0988A.text: AMAZING!!! This was my first visit and I will DEFINITELY go back for more! Food is awesome, staff is great, and price is spot on!! Got to meet the owner and I must say that he is a good fella to talk with and he has a VERY good thing going!! Keep it up!!

Ml5SVicYuRSEg8UB4DFA1g.text: This is where you get to go when you die and are a good person. This is also where you get to go for lunch of you are willing to stand in the line and have CASH. Be patient. It's worth it. This burger (don't F it up - get it all the way with slaw like a real American) is a religious experience. Do you hear me? This is like way beyond Jesus on toast - get that out of your mind. I would be so happy to sit on the ledge outside every day in the rain and eat this burger. If you said, "hey Amber, High end steak house or Brooks for lunch today?" I would be all over that plain white bag. Warning: you can only eat Brooks like once a week tops. It will kill you. But that might not be a bad thing as it is truly heaven on earth.... for $5. Seriously tho.... do this.

RtK-E8v8PoKolKpWMJkLGg.text: Great burger shack serving tasty burgers and fries.  Nothing fancy, but just good, meaty burgers. No indoor seating. Counter service. Cash only. They also serve breakfast.

Otf35szRfPbHts7rpnoFVQ.text: The best burger I have ever had... seriously good! There is a reason there is a long line outside of the door at this very unassuming little shack.

QpU4ckus0ixdNfcDH3N7oQ.text: Took my wife and son to experience this Charlotte institution and to be honest it was the worst burger I've had in quite a while. Meat was dry and burnt and eating it all the way just tried to mask the non flavor. Fries were also too thick, bland and not very good. As much as everyone raves about this place, I just don't see it.

XnZ1zPwr4zs1RW5rYLpMtA.text: The best burger I've had in Charlotte. Definitely would recommend the cheeseburger all the way. Great value.

ycj1dWpBoTo8EPz4n_vPkw.text: Ate at Brooks twice in my life time.  The first time, the burger was amazing.  The second time around, just now, I got home and my burger tasted like laundry detergent.  Had my boyfriend check to make sure it isn't just my imagination.  He smelled it as well. Disappointed!

GWk2vfIzo-HgWzHffY_hQQ.text: This is my favorite burger joint in charlotte. Sometimes can be a wait but I promise y'all it's worth the wait. Cheese burgers all the way with fries and a sweet tea. So dank!

uJgrwbZOBDdhn9B4OwzKZA.text: Great burger especially for the price. They load it with chili and it's the bomb. Only negative is they only take cash but it's one of the best burgers in Charlotte.
